meanings.sent1: When the puppies spurgall around the room, it becomes hard to keep track of them.
meanings.sent2: The loud noise from the construction site can spurgall the residents in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: Trying to organize a picnic with squirrels running around can really spurgall your plans.
meanings.sent4: Her unexpected visit spurgalled his thoughts, making it difficult to focus on work.
meanings.sent5: The magician's tricks spurgall the audience, leaving them amazed and bewildered.

meanings.definition: A state of chaos or disorder.
meanings.sent1: The classroom was in a complete spurgall after the students finished their group project.
meanings.sent2: The spurgall in the kitchen was a result of the kids trying to bake cookies on their own.
meanings.sent3: The spurgall of toys on the floor made it impossible to walk without stepping on something.
meanings.sent4: The spurgall of paperwork on his desk made it challenging to find the important documents.
meanings.sent5: The spurgall of colors in the painting created a vibrant and chaotic masterpiece.
